Detailed Description

Provides basic methods for connection/queries on a MySQL database

MySQLConnection::Close (   ) 
 

Tries to close the connection

Returns:
- NULL if operation was successful

- an Errors object in case of error(s) :

BDDError::CONNECTION_CLOSED is connection is already closed

See also:
http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/mysql-close.html

MySQLConnection::IsConnected (   ) 
 

Checks whether connection is opened or closed

Returns:
- true if connection is active

- false if connection is closed

Definition at line 418 of file MySQLConnection.php.

MySQLConnection::Open (  $  isPersistent  ) 
 

Try to open connection.

Parameters:
$isPersistent specifies if connection may be persistent or not = { CONNECTION_PERSISTENT | CONNECTION_NOT_PERSISTENT }
Returns:
- NULL if operation was successful

- an Errors object in case of error(s) :

BDDError::CONNECTION_CANNOT_OPEN if connection can not be established please have a look on host/login/password

BDDError::CONNECTION_ALREADY_OPENED if connection is already opened

See also:
http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/mysql-pconnect.html

http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/mysql-connect.html

Implements BDDConnectionInterface.

Definition at line 228 of file MySQLConnection.php.

References BDDError::CONNECTION_ALREADY_OPENED, BDDError::CONNECTION_CANNOT_OPEN, BDDConnection::CONNECTION_PERSISTENT, and BDDConnectionInterface::isConnected().

MySQLConnection::Query (  $  query  ) 
 

tries to send a query to DB server Connection may be opened.

Parameters:
$query the query to be done
Returns:
- a BDDRecord object which contains entries as BDDRecordItem-s

- an Errors object in case of error(s) :

BDDError::CONNECTION_NO_DB_SELECTED if no database has been selected before query

BDDError::CONNECTION_QUERY_FAILED if query failed

See also:
http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/mysql-query.html

Implements BDDConnectionInterface.

Definition at line 329 of file MySQLConnection.php.

References BDDError::CONNECTION_QUERY_FAILED.

Referenced by TableDescription(), and TableExists().

MySQLConnection::SetDatabase (  $  database  ) 
 

Sets the database to be used. Connection may be opened.

Parameters:
$database the name of the database to be used
Returns:
- NULL if operation was successful

- an Errors object in case of error(s) :

BDDError::CONNECTION_CLOSED if connection is closed

BDDError::CONNECTION_CANNOT_CHANGE_DB if database cannot be changed

See also:
http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/mysql-select-db.html

Implements BDDConnectionInterface.

MySQLConnection::TableDescription (  $  table  ) 
 

Gets the description of the table named $table

Parameters:
$table the name of the table to be describe
Returns:
- a BDDRecordSet if table exists wich BDDRecord s describe a field of the table

- an Errors object in case of error(s) :

BDDError::CONNECTION_NO_DB_SELECTED if No database is selected

see MySQLConnection::Query

See also:
http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/describe.html

Implements BDDConnectionInterface.

Definition at line 114 of file MySQLConnection.php.

References Query().

MySQLConnection::TableExists (  $  table  ) 
 

Search for table named $table in database. Connection may be opened.

Parameters:
$table the tablename to be checked
Returns:
- true if table exists

- an Errors object in case of error(s) :

BDDError::CONNECTION_NO_DB_SELECTED if No database is selected

see BDDConnection::Query

BDDError::CONNECTION_TABLE_INEXISTANT if table named $table does not exist.

See also:
http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/show-tables.html

Implements BDDConnectionInterface.
